Pre-Game Insights: Both Benin and Libya have shown defensive fragility in their recent outings, with Benin keeping only two clean sheets in their last 11 matches and Libya failing to secure a clean sheet in seven consecutive matches.
Steve Mounie is a significant threat to Libya’s defence, averaging two shots on target per game.
Libya have been able to score in six of their last seven games, indicating their scoring consistency.
Benin come into the match off the back of a 3-0 defeat to Nigeria, while Libya drew 1-1 with Rwanda in their opening game.
Both teams are desperate for points in this qualifier, which should make for an open, attacking game.
